name: El Fenn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week we went to Marrakech to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we stayed at El Fenn which was perfect place for such an occasion, so romantic and charming. This Riad is perfectly located for a walk to busy Medina souks but it is surprisingly quite once you enter the door of the riad. Service is perfect, everyone is so friendly, from the reception, restaurant, driver and the private tour guide. Whole riad is so beautifully decorated with a warm touch in every corner, including our room 7, only rooftop terrace restaurant is not so special, as if was forgotten - still the view and the sphere at the rest of the terrace is fabulous. We had wonderful spa arrangement, hammam and massage, highly recommended. The only min point was a breakfast, the choice was a bit limited.
reviews.title: Very romantic riad
Best Riad choice!
reviews.text: Our 4 night stay at Riad El Fenn was fabulous! We were welcomed into the beautiful Riad by Karima who helped make our stay so enjoyable. The accomodations were elegant and extremely comfortable and the meals were excellent. We could not be happier. Our room (number 16) was spacious and the bathroom large and stylish. It is wise to hire their driver to pick you up at the airport and also to arrange a tour guide to take you around the streets of Marrakech. Our guide was Ali and he was fantastic. The experience upon entering the inside quarters of the Riad from the hustle and bustle of the outside streets is just magical.

I travelled for the second time to Marrakech in September. My travel companion and I are both in the design world (New York and Hamptons), and both agreed that the decor at El Fenn was outstanding and reflective of the fantastic color and flavor of the city, yet also extremely serene and comfortable. I stayed in several of the rooms and would highly recommend the Colonnade rooms, which were all exquisite. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and it is important to note that El Fenn is very close to one of the main roads with taxi stands - so no walking and winding through long dark alley-ways at night. Dining on the rooftop offered a wonderful view of the mountains, rooftops and mosque and the food was very good. I hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Quality Experience

reviews.text: We booked into the El Fenn after seeing it recommended in the Marrakech Select guide. After looking at their website I decide not only would it be a great place to stay but it was definitely a great spot for my 60th birthday lunch.
reviews.title: A wonderful day

reviews.text: As others say it is an oasis of calm and style, with charming staff.

reviews.text: I am awarding this 3 stars purely on standard of food. There was, however, some really nice parts to our experience so I will talk about those first.
reviews.title: Stunning Riad

reviews.text: The lady on reception was great and gave myself, my wife and two young girls a tour of the riad (including getting two tortoises for the girls to see!). The riad is spectatacular, with two pools, stunning planting (with great night garden lighting). She escorted us to the terrace restaurant. So far, so very good.
reviews.title: A stunning Riad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terrace is nice comprising a typical Moroccan seating area, restaurant table, some sun beds and small plunge pool. Very nice with romantic mood lighting for all you honeymooners and anniversary celebrators out there...or those just on a romantic break.
reviews.title: Oasis in the Medina
Marvelous Marrakech
reviews.text: The food...the menu is very small which is often a good thing...do a limited range well is much better than do a large range badly.

reviews.title: An Oasis of Calm
reviews.text: Came here in February to look as we were staying in a French owned Riad nearby. This time we booked El Fenn for part of 20th wedding aniversary as second half was in Bab Ourika. Whilst we were here Ms.Branson arrived and nothing changed in terms of staff attiude. This shows how confident the staff are in their abilities. Food was superb as expected. I can say that all the reviews on El Fenn are spot on. ???

Spent four nights at this beautiful Riad. It's right down the street from the main square and the Koutoubia mosque (walking distance and you can see the mosque from the rooftop). Loved the pet turtles crawling around on the main floor, the delicious morning breakfast, the SUPER friendly and helpful staff, and the luxurious rooms. We visited the hammam for treatment and a massage - A+. If you are visiting Marrakech, definitely stay here!
reviews.title: Amazing Riad in the heart of Marrakech

reviews.text: My wife and I travel all over the world, and stay normally in Very nice places. I honestly cannot remember a better place we have stayed. It just has this cool exotic feel to it. The rooms are just amazing, the food incredible, and the staff even nicer. Coffee and croissants outside your door when you awake, and terrific breakfast on the roof, cooking lesson with Fuoad...can't imagine staying anywhere else in Marrakech.
reviews.title: Raid el Fenn is incredible!!!

reviews.text: I write this review not to provide any new or additional information (the previous reviewers have all done justice to the hotel!), but just to ensure that this amazing Riad keeps high on the TripAdvisor ratings table!
reviews.title: This hotel is too nice! Very difficult to go sightseeing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many stylish places to choose from in Marrakech, and for our annual 'girls trip', I wanted to pick the right one. I am so glad we chose El Fenn. We struggled to do any sightseeing and actually spent one full day using the hotel facilities – the rooftop pool; numerous lounging areas; and the spa. It feels one is staying at a luxurious home.
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4 nights here in the middle of the August heat and this riad was an oasis of peace and tranquility. The air conditioned rooms were astoundingly beautiful - stayed in both 20 and 21 and fell in love with both of them. The hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. We enjoyed all three pools and the chilly water of the lower two pools was a welcome relief after hot days out in the medina and city.
reviews.title: the best choice, hands down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took advantage of the the market tour and our guide, Aziz, was a pitch perfect professional. I'd highly recommend the tour service - the price is reasonable and the degree of hassling in the medina was reduced 10 fold.
reviews.title: Great surprise and relief!

reviews.text: Breakfast, lunch and dinners were all very well done in the restaurant and the service was predictably awesome.
reviews.title: EL Fenn a tardis in the medina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel and look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing erfect base for a holiday in Marrakech

reviews.text: Located inside the medina but close to city walls and gate make it very comfortable also to arrive by car if necessary. Once you enter through the doors of the hotel you are immediately put at ease, a great sensation after the chaos of the medina. The rooms are great, all very different, there are various beautiful courtyards, each one makes you want to sit and enjoy them. We went during ramadan, we were worried that the service would suffer due to that, but it was not an issue, as a matter of fact it made it better for us. Things start late enough during ramadan so that your day is very long so you can actually enjoy the breakfast, pool etc without being in a hurry to exit. The breakfast is very good, the staff is very nice, sometimes on the slow side but it didn't matter because the place was great and they were very nice and polite. We had dinner one of the nights on the roof top restaurant and it was magical, food was very good. Try the hammam. We liked that there are no tv's in the rooms, we also liked the morning coffee and croissant they leave outside the door of your room every morning, and we also liked the afternoon tea set up.
reviews.title: The beauty of El Fenn

description: With 20 individually styled rooms and suites, a four-bedroom private riad, 3 swimming pools and its own hammam spa, El Fenn is a unique boutique hotel combining grandeur and historic architecture with hideaway nooks, terraces and gardens - making it the most peaceful place from which to enjoy Africa's most exotic city.Our story began with two friends on the hunt for a small riad to buy as a holiday home. It was 2002 when Vanessa Branson and Howell James walked into the almost ruined courtyard of one of Marrakech's formerly great private homes. Nearing dusk and with the sound of the muezzin's call to prayer echoing in the air, they instantly fell in love with the atmospheric house which was being sold with three smaller neighbouring homes. They soon realised that their holiday home was going to become so much more.At the time, only a handful of Marrakech's riads had been converted to small hotels and Vanessa and Howell knew they wanted to open a place offering something different – a home from home retreat that combined great food and service with the spirit of the building's past and a contemporary decorative twist. During a two-year renovation, local craftsman used traditional techniques to breathe new life into the building. Polished lime plastering was used in a rainbow of colours to create walls, baths and bed frames, original tiling was renovated and carved cedar ceilings restored. Retro furniture sourced from local flea markets was combined with one-off bespoke pieces to create a unique interior.
